Circles
Circles guarantees your privacy by encrypting everything Start here Built on circles Find apps to use How 
stacks 
works Learn more about us Newsletter Stacks Ecosystem Updates Get regular updates from Hiro PBC via email. We usually send two updates a month, as well as bigger quarterly updates covering the stacks ecosystem. Subscribe Community Join us on discord User Avatar
We won't be able to see, access, or track your activity You'll get a Secret Key that automatically encrypts everything you do Enter your Secret Key to sign in I'm new to Stacks Continue with Secret Key What is Stacks Sign In Secret Key Save The Secret Key you've entered is invalid Welcome Back! Access your account at any time by clicking on the avatar icon, on the top right corner. Discover Stacks App How it works The app keeps everything you do private with Stacks's Secret Key technology
Normally, apps keep your data for them to use. When you have a Secret Key, you no longer have to trust the app with your data because the app won't have access. 

What is Stacks?\Stacks is the open-source technology that generates your Secret Key. There's no company that owns or controls Stacks, it is independent. Go to stacks.co to learn more. 

Encryption
Encryption is always on. It locks everything you do in the app into useless codes. Because of this, the app can't see or track your activity. Your data can only be unlocked with the key that you own. No one else has this key, not even the app, so no one else can unlock your data 

What is a Secret Key?
Your Secret Key unlocks your data. It's created independently from the app to make sure that the app doesn't have it. An open-source protocol called Stacks generates your Secret Key when you sign up. Nobody but you will have your Secret Key, to make sure that only you have access to your data. 

When will I need my Secret Key?
You'll need your Secret Key to prove it's you when you use the app on a new device, such as a new phone or laptop. After that, your Secret Key will stay active to keep you safe and private in the apps you use on that device.
This is how others will see you on other apps. Choose Username Username is not available Continue without username Some applications might require username Something went wrong>
Profile Accounts Create a new account Log out View Secret Key back button Copy Secret Key unknown
Your Secret Key Here’s your Secret Key: 12 words that prove it’s you when you want to use it on a new device. Once lost it’s lost forever, so save it somewhere you won’t forget. Save your Secret Key Store your secret key somewhere safe, along with other critical, private information such as passwords. Once lost, it’s lost forever. So save it somewhere you won’t forget. I've saved it View Secret Key Again Share to apps Copy Copied More Continue
Choose an Account To connect to %1$s
You’re all set! Go to %1$s Invalid Username, you can only use lowercase letters (a–z), numbers (0–9), and underscores (_).
